intro: Rosa klukii var. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic rose, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California, where it thrives in sandy soils and mild climates. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and fragrant, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, with thorny stems and dense foliage. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts aim to protect its natural habitat.
